Package dataframe

Class DataFrame_Copy

  • java.lang.Object
    • dataframe.DataFrame_Copy
  • public final class DataFrame_Copy
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class for performing various operations with a data frame.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Cade Reynoldson

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        public static DataFrame acquire​(DataFrame theDataFrame,
                                java.lang.String[] args)
        Versitility function, arguments in the string array passed to the method will be parsed, and a shallow copy of the data frame with rows that meet the specified arguments will be returned, can take multiple arguments. ARGUMENT REQUIREMENTS: Should be in groups of three indexes, with index 0 being the name of the specified column, index 1 being the specified logical operator, and index 2 being the object to make comparisons on, which can then be parsed and have it's own particle created (refer to particle heiarchy). Example arguments: One total argument will consist of: {"ColumnName", "LogicalOperator", "ObjectToCompare"} or {"Column A", "<", "40"}. Two arguments will conisit of: {"ColumnName1", "LogicalOperator1", "ObjectToCompare1", "ColumnName2", "LogicalOperator2", "ObjectToCompare2"}
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments for the function ({"ColumnName", "LogicalOperator", ObjectToCompare"}).
        Returns:
        a new data frame with rows fitting the arguments.

      • deepCopy_columnIndexes

        public static DataFrame deepCopy_columnIndexes​(DataFrame theDataFrame,
                                               java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> columnIndexes)
        Creates a new shallow copied data frame internally from a list of column names.
        Parameters:
        theDataFrame - the data frame to copy.
        columnNames - the names of the columns to be added to the new data frame
        Returns:
        a new DataFrame consisting of the columns passed to the method.

        Creates a new deep copied data frame internally from a list of column names.
        Parameters:
        theDataFrame - the data frame to copy.
        columnNames - the list of column name.
        Returns:
        the newly created data frame.

      • deepCopy_columnType

        public static DataFrame deepCopy_columnType​(DataFrame theDataFrame,
                                            char columnType)
        Returns a deep copy of a dataframe which only consists of the one parameterized column type.
        Parameters:
        theDataFrame - the dataframe to create a deep copy of.
        columnType - the column type which the new dataframe will only consist of.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of a dataframe which only consists of the one parameterized column type.

        Creates a new deep copied data frame internally from a list of row indexes.
        Parameters:
        theDataFrame - the data frame to copy.
        rowIndexes - the set of row indexes to create a new data frame with.
        Returns:
        a new DataFrame consisting of the rows passed to the method.

      • exclude

        public static DataFrame exclude​(DataFrame theDataFrame,
                                java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> columnIndexes)
        Method to get a data frame with all columns excluding the specified column indexes in the parameter's list. Uses a set (prefferably treeset) for nlog(n) element access time (contains()).
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - the list of column indexes to exclude.
        Returns:
        a new (shallow copied) data frame with the specified columns excluded.

      • exclude

        public DataFrame exclude​(DataFrame theDataFrame,
                         int columnIndex)
        Method to get a data frame with all columns excluding the specified column index.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - the list of column indexe to exclude.
        Returns:
        a new (shallow copied) data frame with the specified column excluded.

      • isSquare

        public static boolean isSquare​(DataFrame theDataFrame)
        Loops through the entire data frame to check if the data frame is square (could be optimized).
        Returns:
        true if the data frame is "square" (n x n), false otherwise.

        columnType - the column type which every column in the new DataFrame will consist of.
        Returns:
